headline: Oatmeal Chocolate Coconut Chewy
description: Irresistible oatmeal coconut cookies full of chocolate chips, shredded coconut, and chopped nuts. Easy to make for a tasty twist on classic treats.

video.description: This chewy oatmeal cookie is loaded with chocolate chips, coconut, and nuts.
video.name: Oatmeal Chocolate Coconut Chewy

name: Oatmeal Chocolate Coconut Chewy

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Cream together brown sugar, butter, and white sugar in a large bowl until smooth. Beat in eggs one at a time, then stir in milk and vanilla.
Combine flour, baking soda, and salt; stir into sugar mixture until well blended. Stir in oats, chocolate chips, walnuts, and coconut until evenly distributed.
Drop by rounded spoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10 to 12 minutes for a chewy cookie or 14 minutes for a firmer cookie.
Cool for 1 minute on the cookie sheets and then remove to wire rack. Cool completely and then store in a tightly sealed container.

review.reviewBody: Absolutely delicious! Just used raw sugar instead of white sugar. Love the finished cookie!!
These are so good!
These are fantastic. I served them at a book club and everyone was raving. My new 'go to' chocolate chip cookie recipe.
Use chocolate chunks instead of chips.
These Cookes are terrific. Easy to make and enough to share with friends and family at the Holidays. I didn't have enough chocolate chips, so added semi sweet chopped chocolate.
Love this recipe! The coconut flakes really add to the chewy goodness!
I let my butter get too warm so they spread out. Tried it again and made sure my butter was cold enough and they were fantastic!
Substituted monkfruit for granulated sugar, used macadamia nuts, and toasted the coconut. Delish.

They’re good, not great. Aside swapping pecans for walnuts - I stuck to the recipe.
We liked the texture of the coconut but would have liked more of that flavor. Also the tended to spread out very little, maybe I’d try adding a little more milk next time.
Was expecting better based on the reviews. They’re good but not great. Worth trying to tweak to my families preferences.
Loved them. I modified the sugar with stivea, both white and brown as my husband is diabetic. He loves them.
Good recipe. Have made a few times. I usually add raisins as well and cut butter down by a bit. Family and neighbors love these cookies.
Absolutely delish!! I cut back 1/2 cup on the chocolate chips; otherwise, it’s perfect.
Good cookies, lost a star for the amount of sugar. (I cut back).
Just made these cookies. Absolutely easy to make and so delicious ! Great recipe and will be making again!

I usually don't like nuts in cookies, but I had some walnuts and even toasted them to make them more flavorful. Somehow the cookies didn't seem fully finished and they had an odd taste. Even my "cookie monster" husband didn't like them. Not sure if I did anything wrong; I followed all of the directions. They just did not work for me.
I'll be making these again!
Awesome recipe! Left out the chocolate chips and it still tasted AMAZING.

very good cookie! I was running a bit short on coconut and chocolate chips so I used what I had and then added a few raisins. I is likely my oven, but I found to keep them chewy I only baked for 9 min.
We Absolutely love theses cookies.

Great cookie! First time I made these I followed the recipe exactly as listed and my family loved them. I’ve made modifications as I’ve made them a dozen times since that first time to accommodate our diet restrictions/preferences.
I now use whole wheat flour, dark chocolate chips, add cranberries and raisins. I’ve also cut the sugar in half and still come out awesome. I know sounds like a different recipe, but this great recipe allowed me to have a great starting point. Still excellent as is!
Love this recipe. Nice chewy texture

This recipe gave me a perfect foundation to tweak to my preference! This says something because it doesn't always work the way I envision it. I substituted 1/2 C of the butter with applesauce; I used whole wheat flour; I used only one C brown sugar and no white sugar (plenty sweet, applesauce helped); I read that someone added a teaspoon of lemon juice to keep the cookies moist, so I tweaked that a bit and added a TBL of lemon juice to the milk (shortcut to buttermilk) and measured my two TBL of milk from there. No nuts in my baked goods. ;-) Also, I have a tendency to over-mix leaving dry cake-like cookies, I was very careful not to do this. They turned out moist and really delicious!
I made the cookies double in size and adjusted to make 12
So so yummy!!! Could definitely change them up with dried cranberries or cherries, different nuts or different chips - super versitile recipe that I will most definitely use again and again!
The best oatmeal cookie recipe I’ve come across, came out perfect and chewy ! Froze half the dough since the recipe makes a lot of cookies.

SOOOO amazing that I had to write in about it. I went a bit heavier on the brown sugar and coconut flakes and went for bittersweet chocolate chips for a contrast - but I am so making this a staple in our household!
Excellent. I had to adjust the temperature to 365, 11 minutes at that temperature was perfect.
I vary this recipe sometimes. I use 1/2 cup semi sweet chocolate chips and 1/2 cup M&M minis for my grandkids. Twelve minutes to bake makes a chewy center. Love this recipe with oatmeal.
These cookies were so good. Instead of 2 cups of butter, I used 1cup of butter, 1/4 cup of coconut oil and 1/4 cup of vanilla Greek yogurt.
These cookies are one of my husbands favorites ! I also added butterscotch chips! yummy!
Definitely a go-to recipe!! 2 minor changes - Chunks instead of chips, and pecans cuz I didn't have walnuts, otherwise, made as directed. Spectacular!!
Amazing!! If you want them chewy go with 10 minutes cook time.

This is the best and only recipe I will ever use again for chocolate chip cookies I used pecans and chunk chocolate chips and white chocolate chips and the new Country Crock plant butter and did like 2 tablespoons of dough to make big cookies and made sure they were pushed all together- outrageous-the best

These turned out great. A bit of trouble with the timing though. After 10 minutes, they seemed raw. After 14, still very doughy. I took them out at 16, though they were still very soft. As they cool, they harden up quite a bit, and 16 minutes was too long. 12 minutes was perfect for the next batch, but just know they’ll come out of the oven still looking underdone.

After reading some people’s came out flat, I refrigerated the dough for an hour first and used parchment paper on the baking sheets. They still flattened some, but they weren’t too thin.

Definitely a family pleaser! Roughly ground honey roasted peanuts (using mortar and pestle) make a good substitute for walnuts about 2/3 cup is it great amount. I have also at times added either raisins or butterscotch chips and had success with both.

Good base recipe to customize on your own! I browned the butter and let that cool before creaming it with the sugar. I added 1 1/2cups of brown sugar and only 1/4 cup white sugar to make sure that they were chewy. I added only chocolate chips and the oatmeal and they were delicious!
I made these for a family reunion, they were delicious and everyone enjoyed them. I was asked by kids to make them for school lunches.
I made some changes by adding extra seeds, dried fruit, about 1/4 cup of powdered milk. They turned out great, it's an easy recipe to play around with.
Seriously good cookie.
Good recipe.
Good traditional cookie. Turned out exactly as I expected.

Well, given this recipe rates so high, I feel a bit of a traitor giving it 3 stars. Didn't change anything, my cookies looked like the "glam" photo, and they were just ok. I expected them to be amazing, ever eager and hopeful about all be-hearted recipes. I agree with others that mentioned it's missing something. You wouldn't think so with the star-studded list of ingredients it has, but , for me, it was a bit of a dud.

My new favorite cookie recipe! It's good as written but the second time I made it, I subbed half the flour with wheat flour and added a little ground flaxseed. I also used pecans in place of the walnuts... just my personal preference. I baked at 350 for 11 minutes and they were delicious and chewy! Thanks for sharing!

Excellent cookie. Will definitely make again. Only changes I made was used 1/2 cup shortening plus 1/2 cup butter because I didn’t have enough butter; sifted flour, salt, soda; used 1/2 cup milk chocolate chunks and 1 1/2 cups semi sweet chips because that’s what I had on hand. Baked 15 minutes. Perfectly crisp on the outside and chewy on inside.

Excellent cookie. Will definitely make again. Only changes I made was used 1/2 cup shortening plus 1/2 cup butter because I didn’t have enough butter; sifted flour, salt, soda; used 1/2 cup milk chocolate chunks and 1 1/2 cups semi sweet chips because that’s what I had on hand. Baked 15 minutes. Perfectly crisp on the outside and chewy on inside.

Came out flat but I was hoping for that. Middle was chewy and outsides were slightly crisp. Will use this recipe all the time now! Note- first batch burned before 10minutes but after refrigerating batch no other batches burned and were prefect at 10minutes.
Tastes ok. Came out looking burnt and uncooked. After they cool, they wer chewt crispy.

Delicious cookies! I used chocolate chunks and 2 cups of coconut. Also made them with 1 cup coconut and 1 cup chopped pecans. They are wonderful both ways and everbody loves them. Thanks so much for my new favorite cookie recipe!

Great cookie. I used 1 c. chocolate and 1 c. butterscotch chips and added 1 c. craisins. Not a fan of walnuts so I used pecans. Baked a little longer so they were crispy/chewy cookies. This recipe is a definite keeper!
no changes taste great nice and chewy
I want to make these now..are large oats better than quick oats & what racks should I use in oven if I cook them at once. Does the lower rack make a difference in time
Very average cookie. Not very chewy and can not taste any coconut. I think i would reduce the amount of oatmeal if i made these again.
Delicious! I omitted the nuts because I didn’t have them on hand. Husband said this recipe is a keeper.
my favorite cookies!!! i didn't change a thing and definitely add walnuts!

These are so amazing! I cooked 350 for 12 min. But other than temp change I followed recipe exact. My husband who doesn’t even like coconut loved these! My son was disappointed when he saw me making these but loves them as well. My new favorite!

Delicious! I made the cookie base as written and added in white chocolate chips, dried cranberries, cherries and berries, pecans, and the coconut. Next time I may try some orange zest and sub some lemon or orange juice for the milk in the base just to see what happens.
Delicious!

I made two changes. I substituted gluten free flour and coconut milk. Baked for 16 minutes. Wow, these are delicious. Makes about 6 dozen cookies. I am making for co-workers and clients at work, my hubby said, ‘they are going to love these. Nom. Nom.’

Followed the recipe almost exactly. Only difference is I used 1.5 cups mixed mini chocolate chips and heath bits, and a little bit of cocoa powder instead of the 2 cups of chocolate chips recommended. Only because that was all I had left in the pantry. 

These cookies were delicious and I'm sure to make them again with very few changes. However, next time I'll likely cut the recipe in half as I didn't notice ahead of time how much it would make.

This was very first time for me to made cookies. Taste is very good and little bit sweetness. This time I followed the ingredients to the exact. Next time I am gonna do a lil bit modify to decrease sugar and semi-sweet chocolate. Really good and easy recipe :))

Will make again :-) Followed the recipe as is because I don't think it's fair to try a new recipe and then rate it with changes made. That being said, I would only add 1/2 cup of coconut next time. My oven is on the hot side so I baked at 350 for 9 minutes and they were perfect.

First of all, yum! I made according to the recipe but used a slightly smaller cookie scoop. They turned out great. Interesting crispy, chewy, and still somehow fluffy texture - maybe due to the coconut addition? I made again and froze some dough balls for later use. Likely to become a family favorite.
best cookies ever! I make them all the time!
By far the best cookies ever!

I found these to be very flat and lacked flavor with slightly too dark of edges. Yes, I did use parchment paper as I always do.
After my first batch, I turned down the heat to 350 and added a little more flour, baking powder and chopped butterscotch chips. These came out PERFECT!! The butterscotch picked up the flavor and complimented the rest of the ingredients. Now I would give these 5 stars!

I made this recipe after cutting the ingredients in half. I used 1tbsp of evaporated milk. Not even sure why milk is called for. I added chopped peanuts, chopped pecans, dried cranberries, unsweetened coconut flakes & chocolate chips into 1 cup alternating until the cup is full. The times suggested in the recipe was accurate. This is officially the “my cookie” recipe. My son: oatmeal chocolate chip. This one is mine. Highly recommend this recipe. Thank you to the author.
Huge hit at our home. I will be adding this on the regular
These are really good! I left out the nuts as I didn't have any. It has lots of chocolate chips which are delish in the cookie. They also freeze really well
If you follow the recipe don't expect them to come out looking like the picture, these cookies spread and flatten.

I will definitely make this again! This recipe was perfect. I made half the recipe but it was still a lot of cookie dough to freeze and save for later. I did sift the dry ingredients and added a teaspoon of lemon juice like someone suggested. This is definitely a keeper. I kept it in the oven for 12 minutes and took it out to rest for about 10 minutes. These cookies are so chewy.

These are the most requested cookies from the guys in the conflict zones! They ship well, just wrap two cookies back to back in plastic wrap together wrap four packs of two cookies in foil and pack snug in a ziplock bag. The soldiers really enjoy these!
Very good cookie with super flavour!
Too much chocolate, said no one ever! Very quick and easy. I thought that it would be too dry once I added the dry ingredients, but it was fine. Didn't add coconut, it was still tasty.

Great mix of flavors. Don’t skip the nuts! I forgot to add the nuts so my first two dozen were without. They’re great either way but I think the nuts made them better. Adds another great dimension to the cookie. I made mine a little smaller since they went into Christmas cookie tins with 6 other kinds. Baked 9 mins and they were perfect. Thank you for this one!

I followed the recipe exactly, it came out flat, and crisp. I thought it was very sweet and Also I could use less butter. Next time I will use less sugar, less butter and 350 degrees temperature and than I think it will be perfect

Made these without nuts and with butterscotch and chocolate chips. They were perfect. Then froze half of the dough and just cooked from frozen and they were even better. I will make a batch to have ready around the holidays!
Super yummy! Made just per recipe, except only 1 cup chocolate chips. They were DEVOURED! Thank you for a great recipe.
First time i baked was good. Second time i added More coconut as Woody suggested. Baked 14 min. More than perfect

The five-star rating enticed me to make this recipe. It was easy and I didn't mind or think the add-ins were too much. I could see where the recipe could be changed up like many others did by using a mixture of different flours, etc. I also halved the recipe and it still yielded a decent number of cookies. The flavor profile was good. I really think the directions should be modified to clearly state that you need to chill the dough for at least an hour before baking. I would definitely use a smaller scoop as recommended rather than a larger one. Also, keep the cookies on the sheet to cool the recommended 1 minute, but promptly remove after that. I rated a 3 only because I'm not sure I would try this recipe again, but if I did, I would definitely chill the dough to see if I get a better result in the appearance of the cookies.

I thought these were excellent -- loved the texture. I had a butter-flavored Crisco bar I needed to use so I used instead of butter and added 2 extra TBSP milk. Actually, used half and half because that's what I had. Only had a cup of semi-sweet chips. Baked in convection mode so reduced heat 25 degrees and baked 8 minutes on bottom shelf and 2 on top and they browned up and were perfectly chewy. I used a small ice cream scoop and ended up with 48 gorgeous cookies. Per Woody's update I will add a little more coconut next time and hopefully will have a whole bag of chips!
The only thing I changed was that I used all brown sugar instead of both brown and white.

This is my new favorite cookie. My wife found this recipe on here and she decided to try it out. This is our go to cookie recipe now. We follow the recipe with the exception of only putting in 1/4 cup of semisweet chocolate chips and 3/4 cup of white chocolate. We also put in about 1/2 cup more oats. We have put in either walnuts, cashews, or pecans, depending on what we had at the time of making them. Amazing.

I did add a tablespoon of lemon juice to it as suggested by another reader for chewiness. I also only used 1/4 c white sugar and 1 c packed brown sugar, almost double the coconut (whatever I had),1 c semisweet chocolate chips, and baked at 375 for 12 min. Love it!
Followed the exact recipe and these cookies burnt by 8 minutes in the oven at the specified temp. I have never burnt cookies before and I am not sure what went wrong..

These cookies are wonderful, I halved the original recipe just in case I didn't like it. Followed the recipe except for the substitution of pecans for the walnuts( didn't have walnuts). As for cook time, I changed it to 350 degrees for 12 minutes like what some reviewers have recommended, which I think is perfect because it is crisp outside but still soft inside. You won't regret making these cookies, a crowd pleaser!

Oh my gosh! These are THE most delicious cookie I have ever eaten! Easy to make. I wanted to follow the recipe exactly, but I only had one stick of butter so used that along with 1/2 cup Crisco shortening. That was the only change I made. The cookies came out so good; soft, moist, chewy on the inside and a bit crispy on the outside. Bet you can't eat just one! :)

I have made this recipe twice. Each time it came out great. I even used a little less brown sugar (1 cup) and white sugar (1/4 cup). I also saved some batter without chocolate chips and added craisins ( because I love oatmeal cookies with raisins or craisins , not chocolate ). Everyone liked them. I'll make them over and over again.
So good! Great, hearty texture. So hearty, that I ate only one per sitting. Chewy, not crunchy. Just perfect. I added 50% more coconut and switched to pecans, per Woody's changes. You must try!
Didn't have enough oats so we only used one cup but also used 2 cups of coconut and 1 cup each of semi sweet chips, milk chocolate chips and butterscotch chips. Cut back to 1 cup on the brown sugar

Sorry Mom, best cookie ever!! Some mods: Unsweetened coconut; coconut "extract" (1t); white chocolate chunks in place of dark chocolate; dried cranberries (1C); sub macadamia nuts; sometimes some Demerara or cane sugar crystals (a bit subtler sweetness) sub equal for white sugar. OK a lot of mods, pick and choose, but the real beauty of this recipe is that it is (as many have noted) both chewy and crispy no matter which mods you choose! Really neat. Who knew?! I always have some dough in the freezer. Thanks.

Instead of the coconut, chocolate chips & nuts, I used a 12oz bag of white chips, 1 1/2 c. dried cranberries and 3/4 c.walnuts. Made them much smaller than some have suggested-used a level Tbsp. (#50 scoop). Baked 375 for 10-12 min, depended on cookie sheets used (dark vs. lt. or airbake) if they were more chewy or crunchy. I may have to make another batch to make it through Christmas. (yum)

Very delicious - esp straight from the oven :) Had to bake these for longer maybe due to my substitutions? I substituted whole wheat flour (1 1/3 cup) and cut the white sugar in half as suggested. Next time I think I'll add more walnuts and coconut as I didn't get that flavor (or sub coconut oil for some butter as has been suggested). Maybe less chocolate chips as well? Though my husband does not agree ;)
Delicious. DH loved them too and he doesn't usually eat sweets.
will definitly make again
Easy to make and good results. Not the best I've made, but tasty nonetheless.
These were a huge hit. Will make them many more times.
The next time I make it , I will add less sugar. It was too sweet, tasty otherwise though.
Excellent oatmeal cookie. Great texture with the nuts and coconut and very flavorful

These were delicious! My Fiancé also loved them.

I did make several changes:
-Cut the brown sugar to 3/4 cup
-Used only 1 cup of chocolate chips
-Replaced some flour with whole wheat (3/4 cup whole wheat and 1 cup white flour)
-Used 1/2 cup butter (1 stick) + 1/2 cup melted coconut oil
-Used unsweetened almond milk since I didn't have regular milk
-I also threw in a few teaspoons of chia seeds. 

The coconut I had on hand was Trader Joe's unsweetened coconut chips, which I blended down to make smaller flakes. I did not add the optional salt. Also, I baked them for 10-11 minutes. Overall, I thought they were yummy and had a good consistency. Next time, I will cut the sugar even more since I thought they were plenty sweet, maybe only 1/2 cup brown sugar and 1/4 cup white sugar.
